segments.text: I see the boy is about to fall, and I can’t believe how reckless he’s being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring out of the sink, and she’s standing right in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why the girl isn’t helping him—she’s just standing there waiting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is the most absurd thing I’ve ever seen in a kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the cookie jar is almost empty, and they’re still taking more.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be shocked when she finally turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the stool is already tilting, and he’s still reaching for more cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is a moment that’s going to end in disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will even get in trouble or if they’ll get away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR
